data.name: XSubToolbarController
desc: special interface to support sub-toolbars in a controller implementation.

This interface is normally used to implement the toolbar button/sub- toolbar function feature. It exchanges the function of the toolbar button, that opened the sub-toolbar, with the one that has been selected on the sub-toolbar.

methods.name: functionSelected
desc: gets called to notify a controller that a sub-toolbar function has been selected.

methods.name: getSubToolbarName
desc: provides the resource URL of the sub-toolbar this controller opens.

methods.name: opensSubToolbar
desc: if the controller features a sub-toolbar.
Enables implementations to dynamically decide to support sub-toolbars or not.

methods.name: updateImage
desc: gets called to notify a controller that it should set an image which represents the current selected function.

Only the controller instance is able to set the correct image for the current function. A toolbar implementation will ask sub-toolbar controllers to update their image whenever it has to update the images of all its buttons.
